CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4a-n,8 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers with 9,9-dialkylfluorene as donor unit and benzothiadiazole as acceptor unit have been extensively studied as donor components in BHJ PSCs. 9 PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties has been improved to 4.5% with an open circuit voltage ( V oc ) of almost 1 V. 10 Compared with the large number of publications on 9,9dialkylfluorene based D-A alternating copolymers applied in PSCs , less attention was paid to spirobifluorene - based copolymers. In the past few years , spirobifluorene has been used as an ideal building block in construction of stable blue light - emitting materials. 11 In the spiro - annulated molecules , the two perpendicular conjugated moieties are connected with the sp 3 -hybridized carbon atom as the spiro center. This structural feature can minimize the extravagant aggregation of polymers containing spiro - annulated molecules and thus can improve their solubility and processability. 11,12 Furthermore , the spirobifluorene structure can prevent the possible photo / thermal oxidation of the 9-position of the fluorene unit to form the undesired low energy ketonic defect. 13 In theory , stable polymer structures are beneficial for the long lifetime of polymer solar cells. Here , we demonstrate for the first time that spirobifluorene can be a very useful building block to construct main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymer , poly[2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene-alt-5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)] ( PSFDTBT ) as shown in Scheme 1 , for high efficiency polymer solar cells. The octyloxy chains on spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units can provide PSFDTBT with good solubility in common organic solvents. The transport properties of the polymer are investigated by fabricating organic thin film field - effect transistors ( OFETs ). The pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution exhibited hole mobility of 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . The PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films show hole mobility of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and an electron mobility of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Under simulated solar illumination of AM 1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) , a PCE of 4.6% has been achieved for PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices. The devices illustrate a considerably high V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm^2 , and a comparable fill factor ( FF ) of 0.60. All device measurements were conducted in air without any encapsulation. Noticeably , PSFDTBT exhibits significantly improved PSC performance when compares with the analogous 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 ( Scheme 1 ) , which showed general PSC performance with PCE of about 3.1% in our previous report.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| 9,9-dialkylfluorene |
| 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene |
| spirobifluorene |
| 2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene |
| 5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole) |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |

Note:

* 9,9-dialkylfluorene and 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene are considered as the same material, as they have the same chemical structure with different alkyl chain lengths.
* PSFDTBT is a copolymer consisting of 2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene and 5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole) units.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| 9,9-dialkylfluorene |
| spirobifluorene |
| 2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene |
| 5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole) |
| PSFDTBT |

Note:

* 9,9-dialkylfluorene and 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene are considered as the same material, as they have the same chemical structure with different alkyl chain lengths.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4a-n,8 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers with 9,9-dialkylfluorene as donor unit and benzothiadiazole as acceptor unit have been extensively studied as donor components in BHJ PSCs. 9 PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties has been improved to 4.5% with an open circuit voltage ( V oc ) of almost 1 V. 10 Compared with the large number of publications on 9,9dialkylfluorene based D-A alternating copolymers applied in PSCs , less attention was paid to spirobifluorene - based copolymers. In the past few years , spirobifluorene has been used as an ideal building block in construction of stable blue light - emitting materials. 11 In the spiro - annulated molecules , the two perpendicular conjugated moieties are connected with the sp 3 -hybridized carbon atom as the spiro center. This structural feature can minimize the extravagant aggregation of polymers containing spiro - annulated molecules and thus can improve their solubility and processability. 11,12 Furthermore , the spirobifluorene structure can prevent the possible photo / thermal oxidation of the 9-position of the fluorene unit to form the undesired low energy ketonic defect. 13 In theory , stable polymer structures are beneficial for the long lifetime of polymer solar cells. Here , we demonstrate for the first time that spirobifluorene can be a very useful building block to construct main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymer , poly[2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene-alt-5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)] ( PSFDTBT ) as shown in Scheme 1 , for high efficiency polymer solar cells. The octyloxy chains on spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units can provide PSFDTBT with good solubility in common organic solvents. The transport properties of the polymer are investigated by fabricating organic thin film field - effect transistors ( OFETs ). The pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution exhibited hole mobility of 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . The PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films show hole mobility of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and an electron mobility of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Under simulated solar illumination of AM 1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) , a PCE of 4.6% has been achieved for PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices. The devices illustrate a considerably high V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm^2 , and a comparable fill factor ( FF ) of 0.60. All device measurements were conducted in air without any encapsulation. Noticeably , PSFDTBT exhibits significantly improved PSC performance when compares with the analogous 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 ( Scheme 1 ) , which showed general PSC performance with PCE of about 3.1% in our previous report.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| 9,9-dialkylfluorene |
| benzothiadiazole |
| spirobifluorene |
| 2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene |
| 5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole) |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| AM 1.5G |

Note:

* 9,9-dialkylfluorene, benzothiadiazole, and spirobifluorene are building blocks or monomers used to synthesize the polymers.
* 2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene and 5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole) are the repeating units of the polymer.
* PSFDTBT is the name of the polymer synthesized from the above monomers.
* PC71BM is a reference material used in the study, which is a common acceptor material used in organic photovoltaic devices.
* AM 1.5G is a reference to the air mass 1.5 global (AM 1.5G) solar spectrum, which is a standardized solar radiation spectrum used to evaluate the performance of solar cells.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| 9,9-dialkylfluorene |
| spirobifluorene |
| 2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene |
| 5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole) |
| PSFDTBT |

Note:

* 9,9-dialkylfluorene, spirobifluorene, and 2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene are building blocks or monomers used to synthesize the polymer.
* 5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole) is the repeating unit of the polymer.
* PSFDTBT is the name of the polymer synthesized from the above monomers.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4a-n,8 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers with 9,9-dialkylfluorene as donor unit and benzothiadiazole as acceptor unit have been extensively studied as donor components in BHJ PSCs. 9 PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties has been improved to 4.5% with an open circuit voltage ( V oc ) of almost 1 V. 10 Compared with the large number of publications on 9,9dialkylfluorene based D-A alternating copolymers applied in PSCs , less attention was paid to spirobifluorene - based copolymers. The octyloxy chains on spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units can provide PSFDTBT with good solubility in common organic solvents. Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 4.5% | PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties |
| 1 V | Open circuit voltage (Voc) of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties |
| 9 | PCE of polymer solar cells based on spirobifluorene moieties |
| 10^5 | On/off ratios of pristine PSFDTBT film spin-cast from DCB solution |
| 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film spin-cast from DCB solution |
| 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend films |
| 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Electron mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend films |
| 4.6% | PCE of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices |
| 0.94 V | Voc of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices |
| 8.0 mA/cm^2 | Jsc of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices |
| 0.60 | Fill factor (FF) of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices |
| 3.1% | PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 |

Note: The units for the mobility values are not explicitly stated in the given paragraph, but based on the context and common practices in the field, it is assumed that they are in units of cm^2/V/s.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 4.5% | PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties |
| 1 V | Open circuit voltage (Voc) of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties |
| 9 | PCE of polymer solar cells based on spirobifluorene moieties |
| 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film spin-cast from DCB solution |
| 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend films |
| 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Electron mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend films |
| 4.6% | PCE of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices |
| 0.94 V | Voc of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices |
| 8.0 mA/cm^2 | Jsc of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices |
| 0.60 | Fill factor (FF) of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices |

Note: The entities that were removed were "10^5" (on/off ratios of pristine PSFDTBT film spin-cast from DCB solution), "10^4" (electron mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend films), and "3.1%" (PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1) as they do not clearly refer to the value of a material property.
